subdivision_of_building: Ground floor extension to rear of existing building - see Proposed Site Plan
description: Extension of existing business premises to provide new paint spray facility
decision_conditions:
Condition : 1 - The development hereby permitted shall begin not later than three years from the date of this decision.
Reason: In order to comply with Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990, as amended by Section 51 of the Planning and Compulsory Purchase Act 2004.

Condition : 2 - The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans and specifications: ([Cover Letter], [Planning, Design & Access Statement], [Fire Safety � Reasonable Exception Statement], [Currie Motor Ltd. 207-209 Worton Road - Attachment Summary], [Unnumbered Location Plan], [Unnumbered Site Plan], [DWG.NoCD10428-01P1a], [DWG.NoCD10428-01P2], Received: 26/04/2024, [Junair � 3 Series Spray Booth Oven, Product Specification], Received: 21/06/2024).
Reason: In order to ensure the development is carried out in accordance with the planning permission.

Condition : 3 - The external sound level emitted from plant, machinery or equipment at the development shall be lower than the lowest existing background sound level by at least 10dBA in order to prevent any adverse impact. The assessment shall be made in accordance with BS4142:2014+A1:2019 at the nearest and/or most affected noise sensitive premises, with all machinery operating together at maximum capacity.
A post installation noise assessment shall be carried out where required to confirm compliance with the sound criteria and additional steps to mitigate noise shall be taken, as necessary. Approved details shall be implemented prior to occupation of the development and thereafter be permanently retained.
Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site/surrounding premises is not adversely affected by noise from plant equipment.

Condition : 4 - Before the use hereby permitted first commences, the proposed ventilation and extraction equipment, including ducting and filtration items, together with any equipment to control the emission of fumes and odours from the premises, shall be installed in accordance with the submitted 'Design And Access Statement' prepared by Chase Sinclair Clark LLP for Currie Motors Ltd of 207-209 Worton Road, Isleworth, approved by the local planning authority. All equipment installed as part of the approved scheme shall be operated and maintained in accordance with the approved details and thereafter be permanently retained.
Reason: In order to protect occupiers of the development site and surrounding commercial and residential premises from adverse impact / odour nuisance.
